intro: Gonolobus antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian morning glory, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and white. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in cloud forests. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the stems are slender and twining.
